page.syntax: FOR EACH Placeholder IN List [ statements ] [ CONTINUE ] [ statements ] [ EXIT FOR ] NEXT

argument.name: Placeholder
argument.description: An arbitrary name. When referring to the placeholder value inside the loop, you should reference the variable's .value property. See examples below.

argument.name: List
argument.description: The name of a CR-LF delimited list, an array, or a collection.

page.description: The FOR EACH ... NEXT operators allow you to step through a list, collection, or array without knowing the number of elements that it contains.
page.example: list = <<%a% a b c d e %a% for each foo in list 'refer to the placeholder's .value property to get its value. if foo.value = "c" continue end if ui_msg_box("", foo.value) next
